channel.title: particles on Visible Ocean
channel.description: Recent content in particles on Visible Ocean

item.title: From FlowCam to EcoTaxa
item.description: So, you have finished lab work and now have an amazing dataset of images taken by FlowCam. What should you do with the images now? There are typically two steps that you want to carry out now:

item.title: Extract individual particle images from FlowCam
item.description: FlowCam is a great device for imaging plankton samples. It takes photos of the particles in your sample and analyzes them using the provided software, VisualSpreadsheet, which carries out particle detection, classification, measurements, and statistical analyses.

item.title: How many particles? Computing normalized particle size spectra
item.description: Using size spectra to describe the ocean ecosystem is the new craze, particularly as in situ imaging devices are becoming cheaper and more capable. The theory behind it is simple: Small particles, such as bacteria and phytoplankton, are numerous, while large particles, such as whales, are sparse.
